column4: I'm running Ubuntu 8.10 trying to access Windows server shares - do I need SAMBA, or is there a better way?  I'm trying not to have to install the whole SAMBA package....
you really just need the samba client, not the server part
I think the client is installed by default

I'm not really sure.. you can go to windows network locations in nautilus by using smb://bla bla bla in the address field I think.. but check the ubuntu samba docs for more info, type !samba here in the channel for some bot info
